alert.note: Alert for Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waushara (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 2:24AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Brown, northwestern Calumet, Winnebago, southeastern Waushara, southern Oconto, Outagamie and eastern Shawano Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 223 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pulaski to 6 miles west of Black Creek to near Fremont to near Westfield. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pulaski around 230 AM CDT. Black Creek around 235 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Menasha, Appleton, Little Chute, Kimberly, Darboy, Kaukauna and Bellevue Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
